thread.title: Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market

title: Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market
text: March 12, 2018 / 5:15 PM / Updated an hour ago Nigeria central bank injects $210 mln into currency market Reuters Staff 1 Min Read ABUJA, March 12 (Reuters) - Nigeriaâ€™s central bank said on Monday it had injected $210 million into the interbank foreign exchange market, extending efforts to boost liquidity and alleviate dollar shortages. The bank said in a statement it had released $100 million earmarked for the wholesale market, $55 million for small businesses and individuals, and $55 million for certain dollar expenses such as school fees and medical bills. (Reporting by Alexis Akwagyiram Editing by Chijioke Ohuocha)
